byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

abstract: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, which endured strong criticism for failure to nominate black actors and directors for 2015 Oscars, addresses issue of inclusiveness at Governors Awards; largely non-white round of speakers make appeals for diversity in unusually serious ceremony.
lead_paragraph: Stung by criticism of its failure to nominate any black actors or directors last season, the Academy used its annual Governors Awards to face the issue head on.

headline.main: For Spike Lee, an Honorary Oscar, but Diversity Takes Center Stage
headline.print_headline: An Oscar and a Diversity Lesson
